docs.title: AIR Plugin Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the AIR Plugin documentation. This plugin allows biologists to control image analysis with voice commands, making cell segmentation and image enhancement more intuitive.

docs.title: What is AIR Plugin?
docs.text: The AIR Plugin is an interactive cell segmentation tool for Napari, allowing users to control image analysis using voice commands. With AIR, biologists can zoom, highlight areas, adjust contrast, and mark cells simply by speaking, making image processing more intuitive and efficient.

docs.title: Vision
docs.text: Our goal is to redefine image analysis by: - Making complex image filtering accessible through voice commands. - Enhancing productivity for researchers with AI-driven automation. - Providing an open-source, community-driven tool for image segmentation.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Voice-controlled image filtering
  • AI-assisted interaction
  • Multiple image enhancement techniques
  • Seamless integration with Napari

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: This guide explains how to configure the AIR Plugin for proper functionality.

docs.title: 1️⃣ Set Up Environment Variables
docs.text:
The AIR Plugin requires API keys for AI features such as voice recognition and image processing. To configure them:

  1. Copy the example environment file: 
    cp .env.example .env
  2. Open .env in a text editor and fill in the required values.

docs.title: 2️⃣ Required API Keys
docs.text:
Variable Name Description OPENAI_API_KEY API key for ChatGPT (used for AI interactions) HUGGINGFACE_API_KEY API key for Hugging Face models (if used) AI_PROMPT System prompt for AI-generated responses

Example .env file: 

OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
HUGGINGFACE_API_KEY=your_huggingface_api_key
AI_PROMPT="You are an AI assistant helping with image processing."

docs.title: 3️⃣ Configure Napari
docs.text:
Ensure Napari is installed: 

pip install napari
To verify installation, run: 
python -c "import napari; print(napari.__version__)"

docs.title: 🔧 Modify Plugin Settings
docs.text: To customize the plugin behavior, edit mkdocs.yml or src/ files: - mkdocs.yml → Adjust documentation settings. - src/config.py (if applicable) → Change default parameters.

docs.title: 🔄 Updating Configuration
docs.text:
If changes are made to .env, restart the application: 

source venv/bin/activate  # (On Windows use `venv\Scripts\activate`)
python main.py

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: We welcome contributions to the AIR Plugin! Follow these steps:

docs.title: 1️⃣ Fork & Clone
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/johk3/AIR.git
cd AIR

docs.title: 2️⃣ Setup Development Environment
docs.text:
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -e .[dev]

docs.title: 3️⃣ Coding Guidelines
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8 style guide.
  • Write docstrings for functions.
  • Run pylint to check formatting.
  • Write tests for new features.
  • Update documentation.
  • Keep commits atomic.
  • Make sure the pipeline checks pass.

docs.title: 4️⃣ Writing Tests
docs.text:
Always make sure to run the tests after your changes. Only push code which passes all of the tests. 

# Running the tests
pytest
For more details, see the tests/ folder. If you create new code which does not have any tests, create the tests for your components by placing your tests file in the tests folder. The name of your test file should be test_thenameofthecomponentyoucreated.

docs.title: 5️⃣ Submitting a PR
docs.text:
• Keep commits small and clear.
  • Describe your changes in pull requests.

docs.title: Getting Started with AIR Plugin
docs.text: This guide helps you set up and use the AIR Plugin quickly.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+
  • Napari (image visualization tool)
  • pip for package installation

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Follow the Installation Guide to set up AIR Plugin.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
1. Run the application: ```bash python main.py
  2. Load an image in Napari.
  3. Open the Image Filters dock widget.
  4. Use either:
  5. The GUI controls for filtering.
  6. Voice commands for AI-powered interaction.

For detailed instructions, check the User Guide.

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• OS: Windows 10+, macOS 10.15+, or Linux
  • Python: 3.8 or higher

docs.title: 1️⃣ Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/Johk3/AIR.git
cd AIR

docs.title: 2️⃣ Create a Virtual Environment
docs.text:
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate

docs.title: 3️⃣ Install Dependencies
docs.text:
pip install -e .[dev]
Alternatively: 
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: 4️⃣ Configure Environment Variables
docs.text:
Copy the .env.example file and edit it: 

cp .env.example .env

docs.title: 5️⃣ Run the Application
docs.text:
python main.py
For troubleshooting, see User Guide.

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text: This guide explains how to use the AIR Plugin effectively.

docs.title: Opening AIR Plugin in Napari
docs.text:
1. Run: 
    python main.py
  2. Load an image.
  3. Open the Image Filters dock.

docs.title: Available Filters
docs.text:
• Grayscale Conversion
  • Edge Detection
  • Gaussian Blur
  • Adaptive Threshold
  • Saturation Adjustment
  • Contrast Enhancement
  • Sharpening
  • Texture Analysis

docs.title: Using Voice Commands
docs.text: Instead of clicking, you can say: - "Apply grayscale" - "Enhance edges" - "Increase contrast"

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This document provides details on API usage within the AIR Plugin.

docs.title: 📌 napari_experimental_provide_dock_widget()
docs.text: • Returns: A Napari dock widget for image filtering.

docs.title: 📌 apply_grayscale(img)
docs.text:
• Description: Converts an image to grayscale.
  • Parameters: img (ndarray)

docs.title: 📌 apply_edge_detection(img)
docs.text:
• Description: Detects edges in an image.
  • Parameters: img (ndarray)

docs.title: 📌 apply_gaussian_blur(img, radius)
docs.text:
• Description: Applies a Gaussian blur.
  • Parameters:
  • img (ndarray)
  • radius (float): Blur intensity

docs.title: 📌 AI Assistant (GPT)
docs.text:
• Commands:
  • say(message): Sends a message to the AI.
  • whisper(file_path): Transcribes audio input.

For detailed API usage, check the src/ directory.
